guide.introduction: In this project you will learn how to build the MDF plates for a TurtleBot using simple hand tools.
guide.introduction_rendered:
In this project you will learn how to build the MDF plates for a TurtleBot using simple hand tools.

Relevant parts
  • 1/4" MDF
Tools
  • #25 drill bit (10-24)
  • Compass
  • Coping saw
  • Pencil

lines.text: This project requires simple hand tools to cut 0.25" thick MDF to make your own TurtleBot plates.
lines.text_raw: This project requires simple hand tools to cut 0.25" thick MDF to make your own TurtleBot plates.

lines.text: A compass and calipers or a ruler can be used to make the basic patterns needed.
lines.text_raw: A compass and calipers or a ruler can be used to make the basic patterns needed.

lines.text: Once they are drawn on the MDF, a scroll saw or a coping saw will be used to cut out the patterns.
lines.text_raw: Once they are drawn on the MDF, a scroll saw or a coping saw will be used to cut out the patterns.

lines.text: The plates have a basic outline of a 12.4" diameter circle. Therefore the compass should be set to a radius of about 6.2"
lines.text_raw: The plates have a basic outline of a 12.4" diameter circle. Therefore the compass should be set to a radius of about 6.2"

lines.text: Using a fine toothed saw cut the MDF into roughly 13"-14" squares.
lines.text_raw: Using a fine toothed saw cut the MDF into roughly 13"-14" squares.

lines.text: The approximate center of the MDF plate can be found by scribing a series of arcs whose centers are along the edge of the plate as shown in the second image.
lines.text_raw: The approximate center of the MDF plate can be found by scribing a series of arcs whose centers are along the edge of the plate as shown in the second image.

lines.text: Once the center is located use the compass to scribe a circle 12.4" in diameter.
lines.text_raw: Once the center is located use the compass to scribe a circle 12.4" in diameter.

lines.text: For the arts-and-crafts portion of the project download the Mechanical drawings from the TurtleBot website and print out the PDFs of the plates at a 1:1 scale.
lines.text_raw: For the arts-and-crafts portion of the project download the Mechanical drawings from the TurtleBot website and print out the PDFs of the plates at a 1:1 scale.

lines.text: Line up the pages and tape them together.
lines.text_raw: Line up the pages and tape them together.

lines.text: Use a craft knife to cut out the circle and line it up with the MDF you cut in the previous step.
lines.text_raw: Use a craft knife to cut out the circle and line it up with the MDF you cut in the previous step.

lines.text: Using double-stick tape, attach the paper to the MDF.
lines.text_raw: Using double-stick tape, attach the paper to the MDF.

lines.text: Use the holes marked on the paper as a guide for drilling the holes necessary.
lines.text_raw: Use the holes marked on the paper as a guide for drilling the holes necessary.

lines.text: A center punch will help keep the drill bit centered and will make a small mark that is visible if the paper gets torn while drilling.
lines.text_raw: A center punch will help keep the drill bit centered and will make a small mark that is visible if the paper gets torn while drilling.

lines.text: Finish making all four plates, one of Plate 0, two of Plate 1 and one of Plate 2.
lines.text_raw: Finish making all four plates, one of Plate 0, two of Plate 1 and one of Plate 2.

guide.summary: This project will show you how to build the plates for a TurtleBot without using a laser cutter.
